did.unittitle: Indiana University Married Students' Club ledger
did.abstract: The Married Students' Club was a social club for married students and faculty members of Indiana University. The ledger includes the Constitution of the club, amendments, meeting minutes, and financial statements.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: The Married Students' Club was founded in 1895. It was originally referred to as the Married Folk's Club and was only open to married members of the senior class. By 1905 membership had expanded to any married student or instructor at Indiana University. It was considered a social club for married couples that focused on building friendships between participants while also allowing the couples to improve upon their own marriages.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection consists of one ledger.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of a single ledger of the Club, spanning 1905-1918. The ledger opens with a short historical note on the organization and is followed by the Constitution and a section for amendments. The remainder of the book consists of meeting minutes and financial statements.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Indiana University Married Students' Club ledger, Collection C613, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Book sent to Club member Everitt Emerson Morley (AM Education 1918) January 1918 by Flossie Beghtel, who had served as the Club's secretary. It is not clear how the book came to be part of the Archives collection.
